name: debarking, hardwood, meranti | sawlog and veneer log, meranti, debarked, measured as solid wood | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25942/documentation

This dataset represents debarking of one m3 meranti wood from Malaysia . The meranti wood is produced by (close to) sustainable forest management in Malaysia. ;No data on debarking is available and average European data for debarking pine in the forest is thus used is used, taking into account the modern equipment of the logging company. Mobile debarking is here assumed. It should be noted however, that Malaysia (and other Southeast-Asian countries) have built up considerable sawmilling and plywood processing facilities to process Meranti locally. Emissions from biomass burning are according to literature values.

From debarking process of harvested meranti trees, at plantation site.

This activity ends with the debarked meranti log at forest road. The dataset includes debarking and natural decomposition of the bark
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: data for debarking in Malaysia is not available - instead, European processes are used, taking into account of the modern equipment used for harvesting.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset reflects a high technological standard for debarking. The transportation processes are average for transportation to Europe; transport distance however can vary. Site-specific debarking data are not available but takes place before shipping the logs to Europe, thus European data are used. The resulting bark is left to rot, which is not inventoried.;According to Collins et al. (2005), there is no consumption of diesel fuel and lubricating oil. ;References:;Collins, M., K. Fisher, et al. (2005): Study and assessment of available information for a pilot project on a teak garden chair. European Commission - DG Environment, Brussels. http://ec.europa.eu/environment/ipp/pdf/teak_chair_final_report.pdf
